intro: Morawetzia doelziana subsp. calva, commonly known as the smoothleaf morawetzia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, smooth, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale yellow flowers that bloom during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
